main event: Three objects were observed in the sky near Dover, Delaware on April 9, 1960, with the lead object being larger, round, and glowing bright yellow.
interesting points: The lead object did not have a tail, but a faint visible trail was observed leading the second object.
The objects were in a trail formation, with the lead object being the largest.
The duration of the sighting was 45 seconds.
Authorities stated they were at a loss to explain the phenomenon observed.
The objects were described as moving slowly in a 20-degree arc, drifting slowly north and west.
sighted object: Three objects in a trail formation, with the lead object being larger, round, and glowing bright yellow
